For they hae griefs ye dinna ken,

line_1: But now he's dead, we weel may ken;
line_2: For ilka dunce maun hae a pen,

line_1: Ye aiblins might — I dinna ken —

line_2: O wad ye tak a thought an' men'!

line_1: Ye aiblins might — I dinna ken —

line_1: Where far remote from mortal ken
May view within their near, distinctive ken
line_2: The rocky summits of the lofty Ben;

line_1: Where far removed from mortal ken,
line_2: Decrees of gods they write for men:

line_1: Which Time long past had veil'd from mortal ken,
line_2: And shadowy falchions gleam o'er shadowy men.

line_1: Full seen of Heav'n, she shrinks from mortal ken,
line_2: Did Reason seek her, 'mid the haunts of men.
